overview_of_class: Social media play an instrumental role in today's politics and activism. However, as movements such as Black Lives Matter demonstrate, social media have not displaced but complement street protest and bodily expression. In this course we will explore uses of performance and social media as tools for activism. We will analyze practices of hacktivism and social media mobilization to understand ways in which activists employ body-based performance and technology to galvanize local and global audiences. Course materials include histories of activism, performance and media theory, and analyses of activist campaigns. The goal of the course is to develop a historical and theoretical understanding of tactical media efficacy and to develop activist performances. The course will alternate between lecture, discussion, and hands-on exercises. For their projects, students will use any number of social media or content management tools (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Snapchat, Storify) as stages for activist performance.
name: Performance and Activism in Digital Culture
subject: PERF_ST
